thread.title: Aust bonds up after Greek 'No' vote resu
thread.title_full: Aust bonds up after Greek 'No' vote resu

title: Aust bonds up after Greek 'No' vote resu
text:
Mon, Jul 6, 2015, 9:28 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 32 mins. Aust bonds up after Greek 'No' vote resu AAP â€“ 37 minutes ago Print 
The Australian bond market is stronger following Greece's landslide bailout referendum `No' result. 
With 85 per cent of ballots counted, at least 62 per cent of Greek voters had rejected international creditors' austerity conditions. 
With the result raising the risk of a Greek exit from the eurozone, St George economists said financial markets "have reacted in a risk-adverse manner", driving haven assets higher. 
"Markets will be closely watching the response from (German Chancellor Angela) Merkel and other European leaders," they said. 
At 0830 AEST on Monday, the September 2015 10-year bond futures contract was trading at 96.960 (implying a yield of 3.040 per cent), up from 96.885 (3.115 per cent) on Friday. 
The September 2015 three-year bond futures contract was at 98.040 (1.960 per cent), up from 97.920 (2.080 per cent). 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 2.002%, unchanged from Friday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 3.151%, from 3.151% 
Sydney Futures Exchange prices: 
* September 2015 bill futures, 97.920 from 97.900 
* December 2015 bill futures, 97.960, from 97.930 
(*Closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
